intro: Galium trinacrium, commonly known as Trinacrian bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems that often root at the nodes. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and covered with fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Galium trinacrium is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and coastal areas.
